utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So, which of this kitchen stuff is mine?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: This bottle opener.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: And it’s a magnet!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Look at that!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: How weird is that? Y’know? You’re moving in with me and have the one thing I don’t have. It’s like uh, in a way you-you complete me kitchen.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You complete me kitchen, matey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ross, I know what you’re thinking.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That she’s gonna move in with you and maybe then she’ll fall in love with you and then when she finds out you’re already married, she’ll just be happy. Y’know? You’re just, you’re very sad.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh…my…God! I-I see what this is! You are in love with Rachel!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What?!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Of course! It all adds up! I mean you you’re obsessed with her. It’s always, "Ross, what are you gonna do about Rachel?" "Ross, why-why are you moving in with Rachel?" "When are you gonna confess your secret marriage to Rachel?" You want her!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh-oh, saved by the bell. Hello?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey Rach, aren’t these candlesticks mine?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No-no, I bought those.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ohh! Yeah, I forgot.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That you’re a liar.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No-no-no, that’s great! I’ll be there Monday. And thank you again! Okay. Umm, that was the head of the Paleontology department at N uh, Y, uh U!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wow! Uh what, did he uh, say?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well remember that paper I had published last year on sediment flow rate, huh? They loved it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, who wouldn’t?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I know! Anyway, they asked me to be a guest lecturer! I mean it’s temporary, but uh, if they like me it could lead to a full time job. How great would that look great on a mailbox, huh? "Professor Geller."

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, Professor and Mrs.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And Mrs.?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh! Yeah, y’know you and Ross are still married.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Just kidding!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh! Oh God!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Saved your ass.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, what’s the matter?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, you know that psychic I see?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, she told me that I’m gonna die this week, so I’m kinda bummed about that.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, and I know you guys don’t know a lot about psychic readings, but that one is pretty much the worse one you can get.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Phoebe that’s crazy!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I can’t believe she would say that too you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah honey you don’t believe her do you?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I don’t—she said y’know that I’d have triplets! But she also said one of them would be black.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Just out of curiosity did she tell you how you’re gonna go?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, ‘cause she didn’t tell me I was gonna die until the very end of the session, and I was not gonna waste a whole another hour there! I mean I’ve only got a week left, y’know? I’ve really gotta start living now! , leans back, and starts reading.)

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey everyone!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh hi!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey uh, well, today’s my first lecture and I kinda wanted to try it out on you guys, do you, do you mind?

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Oh that’d be great. Sure!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: "There are three primary theories concerning sediment flow rate. Each of these theories can be further subcategorized into two distinct…"

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, this is it. This what’s gonna kill me.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: "…subcategories. The first of these subcategories is…"

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh Ross! Are there uh, are there naked chicks on that piece of paper?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No! Why?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, I’ve just never seen a guy stare so hard at a piece of paper that didn’t have naked chicks on it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ohh! Okay! Okay. "There are three primary theories concerning sediment flow rate. Each of these theories can be further subcategorized into…"

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Why don’t you open with a joke?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Open with a joke? It’s a university, not a comedy club!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Wait a minute, hold the phone! You’re not talking about Chuckles University?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Ohh! We’re kidding! Oh, we’re kidding!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross, hey you know what might make it less boring?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Thank you!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Some uh, some visual aides.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh-ooh-ooh! Y’know what’s a good visual aide?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Please don’t say naked chicks.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Why not?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I-I-I don’t even know why I bother to talk to you guys about it. Y’know what? I’m just gonna do it on my own with no naked chicks.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That’s the way I did it ‘til I was 19.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! Any good mail?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, you got something from the Screen Actor’s Guild.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ooh, it’s probably a residual check, hey can you open it for me, I’m kinda….

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: "Benefits lapsed."

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hmm that’s weird. I don’t remember being in a move called benefits lapsed.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, it’s not a check. They’re saying your health insurance expired because, you didn’t work enough last year.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Let me see that!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, I can’t believe this! This sucks! When I had insurance I could get hit by a bus or catch on fire, y’know? And it wouldn’t matter. Now I gotta be careful?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m sorry man, there’s never a good time to stop catching on fire.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right well, I guess I gotta go get a job. I’m gonna go see my agent.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, make sure you look both ways before you cross the street.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: …look both ways before you cross the street.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey Pheebs, you’re still alive! How are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ugh, it’s so exhausting waiting for death. Ohh, by the way, do you think you could—

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Pheebs, what-what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I was preparing you for my—didn’t you think I was dead? Did that not come off?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh yeah, scared the hell out of me. I thought we’d lost you forever. Pheebs, you lie down?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, thanks. And listen, can you do me a favor? Could you just umm, wake me up in a couple hours, y’know if you can.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Monica!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hmm?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Did-did you take these back?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No-no, I-I just, I liked them so much that I went out and bought some for myself.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh yeah, they’re really great! Aren’t they?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I loved them!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah. Nice try!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hello!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How’d the lecture go?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It went great! And I didn’t need any jokes or naked chicks either!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wow, that’s great Ross, I’m sorry we weren’t more supportive before.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I knew all I had to do was let the material speak for itself. Everyone’s all, "Ross you have to be funny and sexy." Well, I proved them wrong! And now, I’m gonna pass the news onto Joey and Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That you’re not funny or sexy?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That’s right!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey Estelle, listen…

utterance.speaker: Estelle
utterance.content: Well! Well! Well! Joey Tribbiani! So you came back huh? They think they can do better but they all come crawling back to Estelle!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What are you talkin’ about? I never left you! You’ve always been my agent!

utterance.speaker: Estelle
utterance.content: Really?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Estelle
utterance.content: Oh well, no harm, no foul.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Estelle, you gotta get me some work. I-I lost my health insurance.

utterance.speaker: Estelle
utterance.content: All right, first thing we gotta do, damage control.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Estelle
utterance.content: Well, I think uhh, someone out there may have been bad mouthing you all over town.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Bastard!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! So Estelle lined up a bunch of auditions for me tomorrow and I’ll have my health insurance back in no time.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That’s great, but shouldn’t you be on the toilet right now?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What’s wrong with you?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Nothing! Well, I-I got this blinding pain in my stomach when I was lifting weights before, then I uh passed out and uh, haven’t been able to stand up since. But um, I don’t think it’s anything serious.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: This sounds like a hernia. You have to—you-you go to the doctor!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No way! ‘Kay look, if I have to go to the doctor for anything it’s gonna be for this thing sticking out of my stomach!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That’s a hernia.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Why did I have to start working out again? Damn you 15s!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, we’re a little early, the lecture doesn’t end for 15 minutes.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, but y’know we could sneak in and watch.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, we could. Oh hey look! There’s some Kappa Kappa Deltas! I was a Kappa. Hey sisters! Wow, we really are bitches.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Right! So when Rigby got his samples back from the laboratory he made a startling discovery! What he believed to be igneous, was in fact sedimentary. Imagine his consternation when— Oh bloody hell.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What the hell are you doing?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look, I was nervous! You guys had me all worried I was going to be boring! I got up there and they were all like staring at me. I opened my mouth and this British accent just came out.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, and not a very good one.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Will you-will you please?

utterance.speaker: The Professor
utterance.content: Dr. Geller, Kurt Rathman, I’m a professor in the paleontology department here.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: The Professor
utterance.content: Do you have a moment to talk about your lecture?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I’m sorry, I’ve got plans with my sister.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Monica Gellerrr.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Right, will you excuse us for one moment? What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, you can have an accent and I can’t?! Top ‘O the morning to ya laddies!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Just please stop!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes, yes, Bombay is bery, bery nice time of year.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, will you grab me a cruller? Sit down! Will you go to the hospital?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Dude! Hernia operations cost like, a lot probably. Besides it’s getting darker and more painful, that means it’s healing.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I will loan you the money. Just go to the hospital and let’s just get that thing…pushed back in.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Thank you, but it would take me forever to pay you that money back and I don’t want that hanging over my head. Okay? Besides, as soon as my insurance kicks in I can get all the free operations I want! Yeah, I’m thinking I’ll probably start with that laser eye surgery too.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh Joey’s got a really bad hernia, but that’s nothing a little laser eye surgery won’t fix!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Look, I’m telling you if I put my hand on my stomach right here it doesn’t hurt that bad.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey! Maybe you’ll die!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Sure, now I’m scared.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, we can go together! Just don’t wait too long though, okay? ‘Cause I’m outta here sometime before Friday.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, but I don’t wanna die!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No-no, it’ll be fun! We can come back and we can haunt these guys!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Gimme ‘em!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No! They are mine!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You stole them from me!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You stole them from me!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Gimme them!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You just wanna each take one?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah that seems fair. We never use them.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look, I really need some help, okay? Why? Why did I have to speak in a British accent?! What do I do?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Why don’t you phase it out? Yeah, fade the accent out and people will think you’re, y’know, that you’re adjusting to life in America.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, I mean, come on Ross, no one will even notice. I mean they’re probably not even listening!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: They’re not listening too me?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Of course they’re listening to you! Everybody listens to you.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Monica you really think I should try this phasing out thing?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I think you look fine.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay. "Hey, Timmy, I’ve got a surprise for you."

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh yeah, sure, no problem, I’ll just—hold on one second. "Hey Timmy, I’ve got a surprise for you!"

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So that’s why I feed my dog Purina One! Pick up a bag today!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Exactly.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Or, I could just point to it! Huh? Blah, blah, blah, Purina One, point to a bag today. I didn’t get it, did I?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, okay.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hi. I’m Joey Tribbiani; I’m here to audition for man.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, come on, do it one more time!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really? Really?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay! "Hello Ross, this is Dr. McNeeley from the Fake Accent University, we’d like you to come on board with us full time!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Listen to this! My reading was wrong, I’m not going die!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really?! How do you know?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Because my psychic is dead! She must’ve read the cards wrong!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Eh, better her than me! Hey, let’s bake cookies!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Listen, I’m really glad you got the part.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: But are you sure you can do this?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah! And hey, thanks for coming with me. And thanks again for helping me take a shower.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Now, is that never talking about it again?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hiya!

utterance.speaker: The Director
utterance.content: Hey Joey, we’re ready for ya! Joey, this is Alex he’s going to be playing your son.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hi Alex! And uh, as you can see my hands are not in my pants.

utterance.speaker: The Director
utterance.content: Okay. All right uh, Alex now when Joey says his line, "Take good care of your Momma son," that’s your cue to cry. Got it? All right, let’s do this.

utterance.speaker: A Crew Member
utterance.content: Scene 5, take 1.

utterance.speaker: The Director
utterance.content: And Action!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: "Take could care of your Momma son." "Take could care of your Momma son." "Come on son! Your Momma’s good people!"

utterance.speaker: The Director
utterance.content: Cut! Alex, remember you’re supposed to cry. Can you cry for us this time?

utterance.speaker: Alex
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: The Director
utterance.content: All right, from the top.

utterance.speaker: A Crew Member
utterance.content: Scene 5, take 2.

utterance.speaker: A Crew Member
utterance.content: Take 36 is up!

utterance.speaker: The Director
utterance.content: All right! Let’s try this again! You ready Joe?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ah, just one thing umm, is it all right with you if I, if I scream right up until you say action?

utterance.speaker: The Director
utterance.content: Uh sure.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: The Director
utterance.content: Action!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: "Take good care of your Momma son."

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m sorry! Hey-hey Joe, why don’t you uh, lift up your shirt? Take a look at this kiddo. We have a crying child! Roll the damn cameras!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: Russell
utterance.content: Hello, is Ross there?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Uh no, he’s not. Can I take a message?

utterance.speaker: Russell
utterance.content: Yes, this Russell, Ross’s divorce lawyer, just tell him that since I haven’t heard from him, I assume he’s decided to give the marriage a try.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross got married again—Nooooooo!!!!!!!!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: All right, keep going. We are phasing the accent out, phasing it out. So without out re-testing the results in the laboratory the team would never have identified the initial errors in their carbon dating analysis . Were there any questions at this point? Yes.

utterance.speaker: A Student
utterance.content: What’s happening to your accent?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Come again? What’s-what’s this nonsense? All right, I’m-I’m not English. I’m from Long Island. I was really nervous and the accent just uh, just came out. I’m sorry. So, if we could just get back to the lecture. Umm, were there any questions? About paleontology. All right, look I was just trying to make a good first impression. Obviously, I screwed up. But what you guys think of me is really important because I’m-I’m hoping to get a permanent job here. So if you just give me another chance to make a good impression…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross!! Are you crazy?! I am still your wife!! What, were you just never gonna tell me?!! What the hell is wrong with you?!!!! Ugh, I could just kill you!!!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, hello Rachel!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Have you really done this before?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah! Yeah! Yeah! You just take a big, big swing. Now, don’t hold back. and Phoebe picks up a wooden baseball bat and starts to swing as Chandler and Monica enter.)

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey-hey-hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: We’re just celebrating that Joey got his health insurance back.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, all right.
